repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
Before #30735 str_byteindex() and str_utfindex() couldn't accept an encoding. This lead to many differing wrappers around their behaviour in the LSP code. This was initially suggested in #25272 
Solution:
Deprecate old signatures and remove wrapper functions where encoding can be handled directly

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
• |vim.str_byteindex()| and |vim.str_utfindex()| gained overload signatures
  supporting two new parameters, `encoding` and `strict_indexing`.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -204,6 +204,8 @@ LUA
 • |vim.fs.rm()| can delete files and directories.
 • |vim.validate()| now has a new signature which uses less tables,
   is more peformant and easier to read.
+• |vim.str_byteindex()| and |vim.str_utfindex()| now have new signatures
+  which offer more flexibility and are easier to read.

comment_data.body:
starting to think the encoding param should be the first param. WDYT @lewis6991 ?

that also would imply that it's non-optional, but that seems like a benefit?
```suggestion
  return text:sub(vim.str_utfindex('utf-32', text, s) + 1, vim.str_utfindex('utf-32', text, e))
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -305,7 +305,7 @@ local function matchstr(text, pat_or_re)
     return
   end
 
-  return text:sub(vim.str_utfindex(text, s) + 1, vim.str_utfindex(text, e))
+  return text:sub(vim.str_utfindex(text, 'utf-32', s) + 1, vim.str_utfindex(text, 'utf-32', e))

comment_data.body:
My intuition prefers that the main subject is the first argument, and subsequent arguments are inputs regarding the subject. e.g. `string.gsub(text, pattern, repl, n)`.

Or another way to think of this. If `str_utf_index` was a string method it would look like `text:utf_index('utf-32', index)`.

So if anything I'd prefer the encoding to be last, however legacy prevents us doing that.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -305,7 +305,7 @@ local function matchstr(text, pat_or_re)
     return
   end
 
-  return text:sub(vim.str_utfindex(text, s) + 1, vim.str_utfindex(text, e))
+  return text:sub(vim.str_utfindex(text, 'utf-32', s) + 1, vim.str_utfindex(text, 'utf-32', e))

comment_data.body:
> main subject is the first argument

Definitely agreed. But since back-compat prevents that here I was wondering if it's more awkward to have the subject + index separated in the current way. And the encoding is arguably the "main topic" that contains the subject.

Not a big deal though.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -305,7 +305,7 @@ local function matchstr(text, pat_or_re)
     return
   end
 
-  return text:sub(vim.str_utfindex(text, s) + 1, vim.str_utfindex(text, e))
+  return text:sub(vim.str_utfindex(text, 'utf-32', s) + 1, vim.str_utfindex(text, 'utf-32', e))

comment_regular_data.body:
todo:

- update news.txt to mention new features of the str_x function
- rename double-underscore to single-underscore. [ref](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/30735#discussion_r1812753214)

> todo:
> 
> - update news.txt to mention new features of the str_x function

Do we want to deprecate the old method of calling? And mark is as a breaking change? Or have it as an option? (Although type hinting prefers the new method)

> - rename double-underscore to single-underscore. [ref](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/30735#discussion_r1812753214)

Will do this

> Do we want to deprecate the old method of calling? And mark is as a breaking change?

I think it was discussed/agreed to call `vim.deprecate(..., '1.0')`. And `:help deprecated-0.11` can mention the deprecated overload (see the `vim.validate` note in there for a similar example).

It's not a breaking change until/unless we drop the old variant.

This is a breaking change for telescope, just a FYI if there is somebody we can ping
They rely on the `_str_utfindex_enc` wrapper
Can you give a short mitigation strategy (or, better yet, open a PR and ping me?)

> This is a breaking change for telescope

Changes to private functions are 100% not "breaking" changes.
waiting for @clason to merge since there is a pending telescope change

labels.name: refactor

title: refactor: remove str_enc wrappers
